messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] keeping up
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/26/03 2:54:17 PM, pamsoroosh@mac.com writes:  Before I had kids and it wasn t as
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/26/03 2:54:17 PM, pamsoroosh@... writes:

<< Its okay - subjects come back. You have a lifetime. >>

Before I had kids and it wasn't as amusing, I used to tell people "Either I
have a long time to do it, or I'm going to die soon so I didn't need to do it
anyway."

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] keeping up
messages.msgSnippet: ... They will and you will . Its okay - subjects come back. You have a lifetime. -pam
messages.messageBody:
On Friday, September 26, 2003, at 08:05 AM, Tia Leschke wrote:

>> I'm always afraid someone wont change the subject and
>> I'll miss something interesting.

They will and you will <G>.

Its okay - subjects come back. You have a lifetime.

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] keeping up
messages.msgSnippet: ... Wow, what a terrific idea. I ll have to try it with all my lists. Maybe I ll have time to actually do some work. Thanks, Lydia
messages.messageBody:
--- Tia Leschke <leschke@...> wrote:

>
> If you sort your mail by subject, you can look at
> the first and last posts
> in a thread and then decide. If the thread
> continues, just keep looking at
> the last one in the thread. You'll see right away
> if it's changed.
> Tia
> leschke@...

Wow, what a terrific idea. I'll have to try it with
all my lists. Maybe I'll have time to actually do some
work.

Thanks,
Lydia

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] keeping up
messages.msgSnippet: ... If you sort your mail by subject, you can look at the first and last posts in a thread and then decide.  If the thread continues, just keep looking at the
messages.messageBody:
>
> I'm always afraid someone wont change the subject and
> I'll miss something interesting. Luckily work is slow
> right now and I have all morning to be on the
> computer.

If you sort your mail by subject, you can look at the first and last posts
in a thread and then decide. If the thread continues, just keep looking at
the last one in the thread. You'll see right away if it's changed.
Tia
leschke@...

"Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where
there is no path and leave a trail."
- Ralph Waldo Emerson

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] keeping up

messages.messageBody:
--- AimeeL73@... wrote:
> ljkc94@... writes:
> > How does everyone keep up with the mail?
> > Lydia, who really does try to read everything.

But sometimes I just go thru and
> delete whole threads by
> subject line. I don't even look
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

I'm always afraid someone wont change the subject and
I'll miss something interesting. Luckily work is slow
right now and I have all morning to be on the
computer.

Lydia

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] keeping up
messages.msgSnippet: ... I know, I try too.  But sometimes I just go thru and delete whole threads by subject line.  I don t even look!  If it looks like it got going and got
messages.messageBody:
ljkc94@... writes:
> How does everyone keep up with the mail?
> Lydia, who really does try to read everything.

I know, I try too. But sometimes I just go thru and delete whole threads by
subject line. I don't even look! If it looks like it got going and got
interesting, I can always go back to the archives at Yahoo!.

~Aimee
